intro: Edraianthus kitaibelii, commonly known as the Kashmir golden violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and arranged in a basal rosette. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in specialized gardens.
